content: repeat this until all sets of beads are enclosed remember to gently pull on the bead strand yarn to snug everything into place the perlina beaded bracelet copyright © june 2022 5 after 5 repeats in base construction step 5 end of base construction step 5 - all sets of beads are enclosed at this point if you have any unused beads still on the bead strand you can undo the slip knot and remove them so they are not dangling there and in the way you can also undo the slip knots on the bead strand if they are in your way the beads are secured by the slip stitches and will not come off however don t pull the yarn strand out all of your beads will fall off if you do i like to put the slip knot back on so i can easily tell which strand is which edging round chain 1 rotating the piece around the end to the original side of the base construction single_crochet in the first chain 3 space chain 2 single_crochet in the same chain 3 space shown in photo 1 * single_crochet chain 2 single_crochet in the next chain 3 space shown in photo 2 repeat from * across to the last chain 3 space on this side of the beads shown in photo 3 if you are using a button closure we must pause here to make a buttonhole if you are using a connector-type finding you will sew those on after this round so skip the following buttonhole paragraph and proceed in the pattern of single_crochet chain 2 single_crochet in each chain 3 of this side of the beads for a buttonhole button examples pictured ⅜ buttons are the ideal size for the pattern as written chain 4 rotate the piece around the end to the opposite side and single_crochet chain 2 single_crochet in the first chain 3 space this is what worked for me test your buttonhole size before proceeding and make any necessary adjustments the perlina beaded bracelet copyright © june 2022 6 now continue in the pattern of * single_crochet chain 2 single_crochet in the next chain 3 space repeat from * across to the last chain 3 space shown in photos 4 and 5 single_crochet in the chain 3 space opposite the last bead that is next to your hook this will move the working yarn more towards the center cut the yarn leaving a 5-6 tail and pull through this last single_crochet this is your last opportunity to manipulate the bead strand yarn gently tugging the bracelet further apart to be a little longer or cinching it in to be a little shorter the beads should all be laying flat but secure in their chain 3 cages to sew a button onto this end tie all of the tail ends together with two or three snug but not too tight square knots to
